inclusion.criterion: High-risk as per the Canadian Syncope Arrhythmia Risk Score (score > or =3)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: being discharged home after ED physician or consultant assessment
inclusion.label: met

notes: Patient is a 65-year-old man with history of CAD and prior MI, HLD, HTN, ventricular tachycardia, and syncope. He was recently discharged after a negative work-up for syncope which included the implantation of a cardiac monitoring device.
